intro: Xylophragma claussenii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, bushy herb with opposite leaves that are often heart-shaped or ovate. Xylophragma claussenii is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to thrive. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and horticultural collections.
